I'LL NEVER EAT AT THIS PLACE!!! DON'T RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE!!!..PLEASE CHANGE THE NAME TO CACANASTA TO BETTER REFLECT THE FOOD THAT THEY DO SERVE!!! ...YUK!!! NASTY!!! SUCIO!!!!

Save your money... terrible overpriced food and the worst service.  Sylvia needs to stop hiring her inept servers to work there. They have destroyed this place's reputation.   DO NOT GO HERE!!  The staff does not care about the quality of service or food they are sending out.  I know for sure that what I was served was recooked meat.  It is only a matter of time before they kill someone with their filthy poor work standards.  Also, there was dried up food stuck to my menu.  Gross!!

This business is closed but contrary to what another reviewer posted the other businesses in the complex are open and doing well. I've been here a couple times and wasn't impressed. Staff were nice enough but the place was too loud and the food. Meh.  Go anywhere else and I'd of been happier

Our visit to Sylvia's La Canasta Mexican Restaurant was, in a word, sub-optimal. We'd seen the place for a couple years and never dropped in but decided the beautiful spring weather was our opportunity to try the nearby patio.

Nothing about the visit was a disaster but, as others have mentioned, the service was painfully slow. This meant long periods without water refills, which made the only-adequate food even less impressive. By the end of the visit we just wanted our check and to be on our way -- naturally, this transaction took 10+ minutes. 

I don't know if I'll go back. Seeing that my experience seems to be the standard (for some time now), I think I'll keep exploring the valley.

I am a glutton for punishment.  Had a very bad experience at Sylvias about 18 months ago.  Went back about 9 months ago and the service was so bad we didn't stay.  Went back yesterday because I was in the area and still think about all of the good meals I have eaten there over the last 30 years.  The food was OK (flour chips are really the driving force here) and service was good.  The problem was they have gotten greedy.  In general the fool is a less than average value but OK.  Unfortunately yesterday we ordered a couple of Micheladas with our breakfast.  If you don't know what that is, its basically a beer with hot sauce and a lime in it service in a salted rim glass.  They served it in a typical 16 oz glass and unlike most other places filled the glass with ice.  It was tasty but . . . they charged us $8 apiece for them.  Really?  Probably 6 ounces of beer, a couple of dashes of hot sauce, a lime and some salt.  I am not poor but come on.  Most restaurants do not show cocktail prices on their menu but you expect they are going to be reasonable.  This is ridiculous and the last straw for this place.  We will NEVER return.  We laughed that someone has opened a Mexican restaurant right across the street.  We will try that next time or make the trip to Aunt Chiladas at the point where they also have flour chips but don't try to rip their customers off.  Get a clue folks.  I have gone from being your best advertiser to telling people never to go there.

this place sucks!! they take forever. i got there and was waiting to be seated when someody finally came and asked how big was the party i said 2 and if u have a booth available (which they did) she said okay let me finish cleaning this one for you. i was on my lunch break and i let her know i went to the restroom when i came back somebody was sitting at my table and i had to wait for a couple more mins. after 15 mins the server finally came to take our drinks and we let him know that we were ready to order he said give me just a second. he took everyone elses order and filled up everybody else's drinks until i called him over and said excuse me ive been sitting here im on my lunch break you just keep walking past me. yet he still made me wait another 5 mins he finally came i had 10 mins of my lunch i told him just put it in a to go box please. another 10 mins and i was late back to work.

oh and can't forget how i only got 2 things out of everything i ordered yet i got charged for everything!! way to go Sylvia's!

I cant believe a new business (newly remodeled) would have someone like that woman in the window in the drive thru.  Horrible attitude.  What is her deal? This woman is bad for your business..  Oh and the plate we did get was like it was a child plate or something.  Damn it was small.  There seems to be a different menu...amount for the drive thru.  Horrible service.

Ya this breakfast burrito was so disappointing. First off their salsa is literally just chili pepper paste. There was barely any meat in my burrito and they completely forgot the hash browns. I waited 20 mins in drive thru to get food and they took forever to run my card. First and last time going here
three separate times they've given me the completely wrong order on to go orders...

This place used to be okay...reliable.

Went on a Saturday afternoon - not a busy time.  Sat there for a while waiting for service and was eventually helped.  I ordered a chicken taco salad and a small cheese crisp.  The plate the taco salad came had a pool of liquid on it - so I tried to move it on to another plate on the table and it collapsed into a disgusting puddle of wetness.  The server kindly offered to bring me another - which I took her up on.  Pretty much the same thing.  I think the lettuce must be very wet or something, I don't know.  The whole salad was mooshy and warm and the chicken tasted like cat food.  Ok, I haven't actually eaten cat food - but it smells like this stuff tasted.  No mas, Sylvia's.  No bueno.
Some of the he worst service I've ever had and only 3 other tables in the whole place.
What was once a great place for a tasteful meal has deteriated to yet another sub par strip mall tenante with lackluster food and inept service.

The food and service has really gone down over the last few years. The remodeling that they did certainly did not help pick up any  business, the place has rarely busy when I go. I had breakfast there this morning which was okay, not great. I ordered an egg and chorizo burrito, it was a bit dry. I would say though, they have great chips and excellent hot sauce. I noticed when I was leaving this morning the sign said on the door they would be closing that location effective January 7th, overall the food has really gone down over the past couple of years but I'm sorry to see them go, they've been a staple in that neighborhood for many years.

I live around the corner from this place and I have been several times over the past three years. The first time I was not all to impressed, but because of the distance to other places I have continued to venture over to Sylvia's.  I my opinion the service at Sylvia's seems to be decreasing every time I go.  Today the server forgot the appetizer, I found a rubber band in our salsa, we had to ask for drink refills after the drinks sat empty for 30 minutes, and they seemed to be all out of the mother's day dessert special at 6pm!!

BOOOO Sylvia's.  I think this might be the last time I have eaten at your establishment.

My bf and I just ate here. We are staying down the road and wanted a good authentic Mexican meal. Phoenix is full of Mexican restaurants and its hard to choose but let me tell you this is one to avoid. It was gross. I had 2 tacos one enchilada. The carne esada taco was ok but everything else was salty and soggy.  We were the only people in the place but it was an odd hour at 3p . I will not be back.

Sylvia, what happened?
We normally do take out from the Indian school location, but we wanted a sit down dinner so here we are. 
First, $6 for a kids meal and the burrito was smaller than a dollar bill, no fries or rice on the side??I ended up giving my son half my plate because he was still visibly hungry. 
Second, store bought taco shells? Really? I thought better of you than that. Indian school has homemade shells (or used to). These came straight out of the Ortega box. Terrible. 
And finally, service. Our server tried really hard, I'll give her that but when I ask for new silverware don't point out that you already gave me some. Clearly you missed the part where I'm sitting with four kids who likely dropped their fork on the floor. And yeah, uhh when a family asks for extra napkins please bring more than two. 
The red Chile was still good, so that is why it's a two star review instead of one. 
So completely blown away by the store bought taco shells.

Honestly so disappointed. I am a Phoenix native and always loved Sylvia's for good authentic Mexican food. I hadn't been there for a few years and today, after the heart walk, a party of 12 of my team members decided to go to Sylvia's for brunch. Big mistake, HUGE mistake. The waitress was very nice but that was the only bright spot in the experience. It took 2 hours to get our food and over 30 minutes to get drinks. As a thank you to my team, I decided to take everyone out and wished I hadn't thought of his place. I was embarrassed based on the service, quality of food, efficiency and even a lack of working bathrooms. Don't go here unless you want to wait way too long (without any other customers in the restaurant), receive poor quality food and not have decent restrooms to use while you wait. Like I said, I hate to write this review but this place has changed for the worse and don't want others to suffer through the same experience.

Sylvia's, what happen to you?  You use to be one of the best mexican restaurants with your awesome flour chips and pollo rico.  However, I came to visit the other night and I haven't been in such a long time.  Of course, I ordered chips, the pollo rico and beef flautas.  Let's just say - I think my expectations were a little too high.  

It's kind of like the hot good looking guy/girl that you were acquainted with in high school.  When you left high school, you had this image of them - the perfect person thinking that their life probably is fabulous now 10-20 years later.  Then you go back to your high school reunion anticipating what you had always thought would happen to Mike. Mike gained 50 lbs, has three kids with three different women, works at a Big O' Tires, and lives at home with his mom.  

Moral of both stories: The ending is quite disappointing.

Pretty good place! Coming from Cali, I have a penchant for Mexican food! I loved the taco combo, it was delicious! Huge portions too, wasn't hungry for hours! The location is good, right by downtown, and the place itself is adorable. The service was good, overall I'd go back for sure!

I still call this place "Sylvia's" from its original name "Sylvia's La Canasta."

Food here is legit. And they have a fully stacked salsa and chip bar to hold you over until your food is ready. The seating area is comfortable and ample, stretching out into the shaded patio looking onto seventh ave. 

The area is nothing to worry about. There are a couple of pockets near there that aren't the best but I wouldn't let it affect my decision to go there or not. . .

When this place opened, it was a small corner store with a few regulars and a growing number of true believers. After a few years, its popularity began to soar so they expanded the restaurant and grew the seating areas. 

What can I say? I'm a softie for bootstraps success stories like this one. 

Food is delicious, authentic and cheap. I highly recommend swinging by for a daily lunch special, but the service and food are worth the trip around the clock.

Wow.  I've been going to Sylvia's since I was a little kid.  When I first started going there (and I was so young that I barely even remember it) it was basically just a long room with bleachers and a window where you ordered food, and some sort of self-service chip area. 

A number of years back they remodeled it but the food & chip bar stayed the same.  The food has always been totally delicious and dependable, typical Mexican fare.  The chips and salsa have always been so freaking awesome--three different types of salsa (the chunky one with cilantro in it is my favorite), and two different types of chips (the wonton style ones are the best!!!).  

But I was just there for the first time in a few weeks, and suddenly, Sylvia's is a full-service restaurant!  No more self-serve chip bar.  Now they bring you a limited quantity of chips and salsa, although they bring you more when you run out.  Still included with the meal, but no longer limitless and self-serve.  

It seems like they were still working out the kinks, our servers were pretty slow and seemed occupied with other things.  Took quite a while to get the check.  I also noticed that they have a full bar now.  I think they used to only have beer, wine, and margaritas.  Now they were offering Washington Apple shots, martinis, well drinks, etc.  

So freaking weird.  I can't believe it's a full-service, sit-down restaurant now.  I really liked the previous style more, but I'm sure I'll keep coming here anyway.  I kept freaking out about how crazy it is that Sylvias has changed, and my boyfriend didn't get it--what's the big deal???  I actually called my parents on my cell phone to tell them the crazy news. 

Anyhow, still delicious Mexican food.  Maybe they were having problems with people taking way too many chips and wasting them, and needed to save some money in this crappy economy.

The good:

 To be honest ,I've had better (this is not a knock against them, just been to a lot of Mexican restaurants), but I think it is very good. Definitely at least a 7 out of 10, even on a bad night. Chips and salsa is very good.

I really like Friday night live music In Mateo's, the bar side of Sylvias.  A band that plays there often, called Picoso, is a real treat!  They are made up of veteran musicians and music teachers, and do some great classic rock cover tunes, from Beatles to Santana. 

they have a nice out door seating area, Spanish tile and a fountain make it very esthetically pleasing and relaxing.

The Bad:

It takes forever to get your order taken.  I've been there probably 20 times, and we go through this every time.  We usually sit in the Mateo bar side.  The bartender and/or waitress takes forever to get us chips, or even to take our order.  They crawl for the drinks, too.  When in the restaurant side, you get faster service, but not by much.

I recommend them, but just go with the expectation of waiting a while for service and inattentive servers.

For $5.99 for daily lunch specials, Sylvia you are the bomb. Kudos for the shredded beef and non-greasy taco. I split your meal into lunch and dinner - and I'm still full!

You are minus a star because you gave me heartburn - your salsa and flour chips are TOO freakin' DELISH for your own good.
Terrible , Walked in, no one in restaurant, we said hello loud a couple of times. Saw two people in kitchen that never looked up. No one came out so we left.

I'm really surprised by the reviews.  We had a great experience.  The salsa selection is amazing.    Chicken enchilada was great as were the chicken and machaca tacos.  The crab enchilada was just okay.   Really cool decor.

Have to thank my breos for taking me here with which I would probably have not found this place.  So i was given the disclaimer about this homemade salsa because there is an addiction withdrawal factor.  Holy smackanolies, this salsa was mmmmmmmmmm!!!!!!!!!!!!!  
We killed 2 bottles of this heavenly salsa. 
Had the #1 lunch combo which was a taco, tostada and tamale.  All really good, authentic, and grubbin.  The tamale had a hint of sweetness, which went perfect with my horchata, mmmmmmm!!!!!.  One of the best horchata I've had also, not to chalky not to sweet.  
Service was great although we did get the vip tavo service, free guac and refills.  Lunch time crowd can get quite busy.  I believe this mexican spot was est in the 70s, but its definitely been a local favorite for a long time.  If only they bottled that salsa!

Where's Shawna? I've been here several times since the remodel and always got great bar service from Shawna. If rumors are true and she's gone, I'm going elsewhere.  There's too many bars on 7th to not expect the best service. 
And fix the damn toilet in the ladies restroom!

I have frequented Sylvia's for many years prior to their remodel. Tonight was the first time service was HORRIBLE! Waited over 20 minutes to be acknowledged after we were seated. My husband was served two sodas that were so flat, they looked like tea. I ordered Pinot Grigio that was served only after my husband reminded them, 30 minutes later. It was served hot. 
Our order was taken and not written down. The waitress came back to write it down because she forgot. 30 minutes later the other server came over to take our order again because the waitress didn't put it in... we left! So sad! We used to love it!  An hour wasted and we are hungry!

The food is average, with the exception of the chips. The chips are fantastic. They are a combination of traditional tortilla chips and thick, deep-fried tortilla slices. Very good. The service was bad. Most, if not all, of the servers just don't care and show it.

I quit. Gone are the days of bringing in all of my friends and family to eat at yummy Sylvia's. My boyfriend and I used to go AT LEAST three times a month, but the service just kept getting worse and worse. We stopped going, but really missed the street tacos and flour chips and salsa, so we decided to try again. 

There was about 10 minutes left of happy hour. By the time our waitress came it there was only about 5 minutes left. I asked if I could get a margarita on happy hour and she said it was too late. We ordered flour chips... which we never received. Then, our waitress disappeared for a pretty ridiculous long amount of time. She apologized when she came back explaining that she was held up in the bar section. That's fine. Stuff happens. Then we finally get to put in our dinner order. We were going to split something, but I really wanted to try a navajo taco. Then she disappeared forever again. When we got our food my navajo taco was SUPER burnt, and completely not the kind that I had ordered. We had been there so long at that point that we decided to just go ahead and share. The burrito was good, but not worth the wait. 

Never. Going. Back.

Sylvia's has the best red chili in town. Alexander hit the nail on the head with his review. Sylvia's is the upscale version of Los Compadres down the street in most every way. Salsa bar for fresh pico de gallo (for eat-in only), full bar available next door or beers on ice at the register, and colorful decor throughout.

My problem with Sylvia's is the price you'll pay for counter service. For these prices (basically twice Los's) we should get sit-down service. Well, to each his own. For the sit down service, just go a mile to the east to Manuel's at 7th Street. I have a problem paying an extra $0.85 for a slab of butter with my tortilla and $0.65 for extra cheese, just two examples.

This red chili is the stuff of legend. The meat is roasted just right and falls apart when you fork it and then it melts in your mouth. The red sauce is perfection with its thickness.

They are at their best when putting on their holiday buffet brunches. Scoop your plate full with the guacamole (usually $3.25 each) and the chips (and tortillas) that make La Canasta famous throughout the valley. Oh, and don't forget a healthy helping of the best red chili in town. Yum.

I only had drinks in the bar, Mateo's I believe it's called. The bartender, "Captain" Ron was very friendly and made a great margarita....Like I'm sure most bartenders in Phoenix. Chatted with a couple cool ladies sitting at the bar who lived in the area, they said they are regulars and love the place. I will be back to try the food very soon.

Prior to the remodel I would say the service was 3 stars at best. Our recent experience on 01/13 was the WORST ever. 

We've been going here for YEARS. I'm afraid those days are over. 

Waited nearly 5 minutes to be seated. No waiting list. That was the time prior to anyone even acknowledging we were standing there. 

While the food hasn't changed; it still good; the service was horrible. One server. Took us two hours to be seated, order, get served, eat and pay. 

Had to ask constantly for refills on beverages. Server came by once to see if we were ok. 

The salsa "bowl" was maybe 2 oz. We asked for a larger bowl; brought us the same damn size. Some chips in the basket were gummy!  Yuck. 

I don't know how anyone feels good serving that. 


The restroom has NO soap. The soap dispenser was empty. They had a bottle of soap on the counter that someone had added water to GROSS. 

One of the stall "out of order". 

Light fixtures over the sink; all but one bulb was burned out. 

NO TOILET PAPER. 

Did I mention these just went through a remodel!!!!

To the owners of Sylvia's. I'd recommend new staff and manager before NO ONE comes to visit. Because clearly what's being done now is only hurting your business. 

God luck. We won't be back. I'll drive all the way downtown to La Canasta next time.

This is so disappointing.  I have been patronizing all of the Sylvias & La Canasta restaurants for 15 or so years.  This was the one that started it all for me.  Somewhere around 2008 is when bad thing started.  I dont know if it was the economy or something else but the proprietor began making changes.  The first thing to go was the chip/salsa bar and thats what brought people in; their hot sauce is amazing.
Then strange wooden statues, atm machine, childrens play area with old used toys.  This was about the time I stopped going to this location.  I mean originally they had bad booth benches/tables/chairs, odd pictures of family (glamour shots?) on the walls but the service was good, the wait staff was good so you could deal with it.  Then came the remodels.  All they ever needed to do was get some good tables and chairs and maybe put some decent Mexican style artwork on the walls and Mexican music and this place would be special.  
Today I came back and its sad.  Its about 1/3 the size it used to be and there were only 2 people working.  One was both a waitress AND the cook.  I feel bad for the staff because its clear theres no support from the owner.  2 people working in a restaurant on a saturday.  2 people got up and left while we were there because it was taking so long.  Its no wonder they're losing business.  
Truthfully, if we could go back to 2008 and have Sylvia literally do the OPPOSITE of everything she did, they would be better off.  It had real potential and I always felt attached to it but no more.
I gave 2 stars out of pure nostalgia but I wont be back and thats sad.

Came here for breakfast yesterday, it had been years since I have stopped in here and do not remember the entire place having waiter service.  Place was empty at 9am on a Tuesday morning but the atmosphere was casual, this place is pretty much been here for as long as I can remember and I am one of the 2 people that are native to Phoenix.  I always felt it was pricey but I think inflation has caught up since prices seemed normal when I went yesterday.  I loved the chips and salsa, the hot sauce is fantastic with a great spicy kick.  I went with the recommendation of the chile relleno which isn't my favorite but I like going with what waiters say so I gave it a try.  It was great!  Very flavorful and they just put it on the eggs so you can eat it together, the tortillas are fresh and home-made tasting, the hash browns and beans were good too.  I read my newspaper and drank my soda while I enjoyed the whole place to myself....oh yeah, I read some Yelp reviews and bookmarked my next stop too, ha ha.

I have been to Sylvia's many times. I think they are about average for a Mexican food restaurant in Phoenix. I have had their Chimichangas, green chile burritos, red chile burritos and their bean burritos. 

Their best item is the refried beans. If you are interested in a delicious bean burrito, this is your place. If you are making something that would be complemented with refried beans, come in and order a pint because these beans are delicious. Their tortillas are pretty standard, I think Carolina's make a better tortilla. I think the enchilada sauce could be better but it isn't the worst enchilada sauce I have ever had. 

They have a pretty large bar on 7th ave and Missouri with excellent happy hour specials and live music.

It looks like this place is hit and miss based upon the reviews. Today I went here for the first time and it was a hit! 

The flour tortilla chips are SO good, the corn ones too, but, the flour ones were amazing. I'd never had them at ANY Mexican restaurant before.. Pico de Gallo is also great. I had ala carte for everything. I had a cheese enchilada, chicken taco & tamale. All were very good. The server was friendly and gave drink refills often. When we first arrived, there was nobody to seat us and people on the patio were complaining that nobody had even come out to get drink orders. It almost felt like everyone was taking a lunch break prior to their lunch rush! 

Once seated, we had chips immediately & drinks too. We all had iced tea, so, I can't report on the margaritas. It was solidly good food. I had no complaints at all. I'd return next time I'm in Phoenix! :)

Have dined in here a few times and have no complaints. They bring out a basket of chips and one bowl of chunky salsa and one bowl of the hot sauce salsa - both are delicious and they refill them too. 
I usually order an enchilada as my meal and it's yummy.
Excellent pork green chile and hash browns for breakfast coupled with fast, friendly service at a great price.  We'll be back!

I have gone to Sylvia's for many years and it is apparent there is new management who have taken over the business.  When I came in, I was seated at a table over by the television set, which was fine.  I was facing the window, so to my right was a group of men already eating their lunch and to my left, was an empty table.  I was given a menu when I sat down,but  no chips, drink order or anything.  A few minutes after I was seated, the same lady seated a man and a woman and immediately gave them their chips.  The next thing I see, they had their drinks and then that same lady (in glasses) was taking their order.  I still had not even received any chips.  I was somewhat ticked off at this point and picked up my purse and left.  I did not say anything, because I am NOT the waitress, I was the customer.  Oh well, they not only lost one customer, but three others because my family would go there too.

It's still hot. They now have table service, and it is terrible. It seems like morale is really low at this place. The hosts and waitstaff look like they all can't wait to leave, and that shines thru while they're "helping" you.

If you are looking for great Mexican food, take a trip 8 miles south and go to the Original La Canasta.

Surprise !!!   The prices in menu are not the same on the bill.   Guess which is more ?  Oh it was nicely explained by wait staff after we ate.  Food was bland or I would not have minded.  Our order was screwed up too.

If you come here expecting good service, in the exact same fashion I'd laugh at a crappy comedian. The service is awful, they forget minor things all the time and give seemingly smart ass answers when you have questions.

Me: "What's Fritanga?"
Her: "It's an omelette."
Me: "I know it's a %$#@in' omelette as it SAYS fritanga OMELETTE. But what is fritanga!?"

Or:

Me: "Can I get lime instead of lemon?"
Her: "It comes with it."
Me: "It says lemon comes with it. I am asking for lime."

I THINK it might have to do more with comprehension than anything else. I hope they don't spit in my food.

However, the food is great. I am giving it 3 stars due to horrible service. At least it's not really slow. Their beans are consistently delicious, and their red chile is the best in town. I also really enjoy their chile relleno, but their salsas could use some work.

Go to the one on 7th Ave and Grant. It's much better for some reason.

This is our second time here. Once before they remodeled and again after the remodel. The first time we went the food was good but the service was terrible and the cleanliness was an issue.  We decided to give it another chance after the remodel. There were only two other tables with with people there. They say us all right next to each other which is ridiculous. We could all hear everything being said by the other tables. I sat down and in the booth was a used straw and spilled salsa and food on the cusion. I opened the menu and there was salsa spots on the menus too. Cleanliness has not improved with the new remodel. We ordered and sat there for almost 30 minutes before our food came. We were the only people left in the place when our food got there. This was at 5pm. Our waiter was not very attentive and we had to wait for drink refills. It is unfortunate because the food actually tastes good. We won't be back. I would recommend going across the street to La Pinata. The service is good and the food is delicious.

I had lunch here again the other day and I realize I was either very high or absolutely starving last time I ate here. This visit I pretty much had the opposite experience. The food was horrible. The salsa had chunks of tomatoes as big as my fist, the burrito was dry and bland. They sat us in a room under a TV and it was so loud we could barely talk. I'll have to go back though... At least give them one more shot..

The remodel has not been kind to this place. I ordered a beef taco and got served a tiny nasty looking chicken taco on a grocery store hard taco shell. The Cinco de mayo special margarita tasted like sugar water. At least the chips and salsa were good. I remember this place being much better in the past. It seems like they are trying to offer inexpensive specials which I appreciate but the stuff coming out of the kitchen is just gross. The 5.99 taco special at the new drive through were barely edible, grey ground beef, odd flavor and so watery the tacos feel apart immediately.  With two other taco places across the street I don't know how they are going to make it.

Worst Mexican burrito I have ever had. Julian, the waiter, couldn't get my husband's order right. Tacky dining areas with bookshelf in front without any meaning. Looks like they tried to create vintage vibe but were too cheap, so bought old furniture from yard sales. 

So the burrito - it was ground beef burrito with supposedly cheese and onions. Not much cheese or onions, but tortilla was two-fold. Ground beef was overly ground with watered down spices. Chipotle seems amazing in comparison.

TERRIBLE SERVICE. When me and boyfriend first arrived we stood in the door way for about 4 minutes before we were seated, we were never greeted. There was only two other families in the resturant at the time. The female manager who was also our server,  came up didn't introduced herself or greet us, instead she grabbed two menus and walked away and placed them on a table then looked at us as a gesture to sit there. We sat down at and ordered our food. I ran out of water and was not offered another glass, i had to ask. I was served cold stale rice along with our order also being incorrect. While waiting for our food  the server sat another couple in the same manner she sat us and made it very apparent that was the quality of service given at the restaurant. If your looking to be treated properly this is not the place to come.

I probably wouldn't give it any stars.  Decided to try Sylvia's for the first time today. 
Terrible. Husband ordered a drink... I ordered a beer. Ordered an appetizer as well. 
Beer was delivered. No glass. Asked for one. 
Appetizer came. ( still no drink for husband)
His drink was supposed to have Tres Generations tequila in it. I see the " bartender" take Patron off the shelf. Big difference. 
I went up and asked. He said they don't carry Tres Generations. That would have been nice to know when he ordered. 
Saw him straw test it as well as straw for a customer at the bar. Clearly has no idea how to make a drink. Really? It was a $9 Signature cocktail. 
No silverware... got up to get it myself. 
Now the best part.... Food comes and our server proceeds to leave the establishment. 
We are just about done with our mediocre meal.... and in walks our server with phone up to get ear and a Starbucks coffee in her hand. Un-freakin-believable. 
Brings check and says I'll be your cashier... how was everything. A little too late for that. 
NEVER AGAIN. 
There are too many great places in our area to go here. Stay away.

First time here since the remodel. I used the drive through and ordered 5 taco's. The woman in the drive through wasn't very friendly. She seemed like she was in a hurry and gave me the feeling that I was an inconvenience. For an empty parking lot and no cars in the drive through, she could have at least faked it for a minute. After I arrived home I was disappointed that my tacos didn't come with any hot sauce. I'm not sure if I was suppose to ask for that separately or if it was left out in error. The tacos were equally disappointing. They had no flavor. The meat tasted like it was from taco bell. Sylvia's should be embarrassed to sell these taco's and consider themselves a Mexican Food restaurant. This probably sounds harsh, but honestly, taco bell has better tacos. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing, but if you can't get a taco right, you have big problems! In the event that Sylvia's reads this, I would suggest customer service training with your servers. As far as the food, I don't know what to say? Really wanted to like this place... so disappointed!

Close your doors!! Food =taco bell service-terrible 
Asked to speak to manager ya she was the horrible service.  SAd But True.  Phx landmark no more

The food was good but the service really wasn't all that. In fact it was terrible. We came in on a Friday night around 9:30 PM it wasn't crowded but it took 20 minutes before staff noticed us seated waiting to order. The waitress provided lousy service by not checking on us till it came time to pay. The music was blasting from their cantina which made it difficult to hear much less have a conversation. I would not recommend this place unless you want 2nd rate service and have extra patience.

Wish I would have read the reviews before ordering on UberEATS. Decided after placing the order that we needed a side of rice. Called UberEATS who contacted the restaurant, the restaurant told them I had to call in. I called Sylvia's and asked that the side be added to my order(which I know restaurants can do when an order is placed through UberEATS) only to be told they "don't do that" and then put on hold by the rudest woman (Amanda) because she was "too busy there" her words not mine. Over 10 minutes on hold, in that time my order was picked up and delivered. Needless to say worst customer service and I won't ever be ordering from here again.

UPDATE: 

Food arrived and although I repeatedly wrote extra hot sauce they sent one tiny cup of hot sauce/salsa for an order for 2 burritos. FAIL.

Mediocre food and the service was comically bad. The refried beans tasted like they came out of a can and warmed up in a microwave. The chile relleno was bland and mealy. 

I kept having to ask for the server to bring my iced tea several times after she brought everyone else's drinks. 

I ordered a side of rice and beans (apparently the chile relleno doesn't come with it), which the server didn't bring when she brought the entree. I asked the server about it, and she brought just the beans. I had to ask again for the rice. 

Then she kept bringing the wrong check. One person had to ask three different times. It was absurd. I won't be back.

This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in town.
They have the usual/expected menu, tacos, burritos, enchiladas, etc., at really reasonable prices. In the years that I have been going there the food has always been delicious and everyone I have taken has been won over. 
The staff is friendly and attentive, I have always had really good service.
I can't say enough about La Canasta. This place is awesome.
Two things, though, the dining room closes at 7 pm and they don't do separate checks.

Sylvia's is one of a few decent Mexican restaurants where you can sit at a real table to take your time eating instead of scarfing your food at a teeny diner-style table, in your car, or waiting until you get home.  

Their new cost-cutting measures aren't very customer friendly, but everyone is pinching pennies these days, and Sylvia's is my neighbor. I think there is a sign that says Sylvia's doesn't use lard. 

Sylvia's also sells both regular and mini-tamales in bulk, which are great for parties. I've ordered the minis and then frozen the extras. They were a big hit (I ordered extra).

I get the feeling it's on its way out, which is sad.

Sat at the bar for dinner. The bartender appeared to have been injured and walked with a stoop. I felt sorry for him as he struggled to provide things like set-ups and drinks. We waited far too long for a simple order (Nana's chili and a burrito). The food was bland when it finally arrived. The only napkins were cocktail napkins. Even the check took too long to get there. The guy obviously needed help, but no one was helping him.

Too many other better choices around. I can't think of a reason for a return visit.

Yesterday was my first visit to this delightful family establishment.  I was seated promptly by Amanda, a very friendly and accommodating server. The chips and salsa very fresh, I especially liked the red sauce!  I ordered a bowl of the green chili, delish, I think the flour tortilla was home made!! All of the food came out in a very timely manor, add all of this plus the welcoming environment I would definitely recommend for a great lunch or dinner.

I grew up going to the Sylvia's on Van Buren so I was excited when I found this location. Sadly though it's terrible. The renovation is cute but it can't mask the terrible service and people it employs. Service is really slow and they are pretty rude. The drive thru was a great addition in theory so you could still get food and not have to deal with the service BUT that too sadly was a major fail. We live about 5 minutes away and my food was cold when we got home to eat it. I also ordered a shrimp plate for my 17 month old but it was too spicy for him to eat so he didn't get a meal. I called just to notify them of the issue and there was no manager. I called again the next day and no one answered. I called again today and got he most rude unprofessional person I ever encountered. I won't go into detail but if a manager wants to contact me I will provide more information. She also said they are closing in a few days which is no surprise after the experience I had over the phone with a girl who gave me two fake names. Today is 1/3 and I spoke with her (name starts with a B) around 2:30.  I will be disputing these the charges as I did not receive the correct goods or services. We had to trash the whole meal.
This place has a drive thru.  I ordered the number 10 it was actually very good food and very fast service I will definitely be going there again

So excited for the cute lil patio. Waited 40 minutes for a queso dip appetizer, another hour after for our chimichangas. They were just full of excuses too. Offered us a whopping 10 percent discount. Wow thanks. This was a second chance for my company who had the same problem the time before. Won't waste the time or money to come back. Every table on the patio was complaining. They weren't that busy and that kind of food is already prepped. Ugh.

Well, my husband really liked his dish a breakfast burrito, but I ordered beef fajitas. They were gross, not good flavor, very greasy. I had to go out elsewhere after I got home with our take out. Whatever you do, don't get the fajitas.

They had a cute patio, too bad it's too cold to be sitting outside.

When my boyfriend and I walked in, we got confused. No one came to us, greeted us or anything. We had to walk into another room, then they sat us down.

Omgggg chip and salsa is sooo yummmmyyy. We had to ask dor seconds. Lolz 

I had the vegetarian chimichanga dinner, it was very crispy and delicious, the texture was just right. The bean though, was amazing. Something about the beans was really good. :)))

Steak fritanga ;; he said " i loveed, it was so muchhh food.I am full."

I shall return

This place is awesome! I went here before with my boss and I had their Machaca tacos...and this is when I fell in love with Machaca. 

I went here again for breakfast this time with my boss. I had the Machaca con Huevos and oh my...it was amazingly delicious! The really cool thing about going here for breakfast was that they still serve chips and salsa right way. It was great! They have traditional chips, but they're chips are like wontons. It's really good!

Service has been great every single time I've been here. It's a definitely must-try place. Enjoy!
Placed an order through UberEATS figuring that I'd give them a shot. An ill fated choice on my part considering that we received completely wrong items. Never again will I order from here.

I can speak for the ground beef enchiladas, tacos and their own style hot sauce! The are the best in town. Yes, sometimes a wait with lower help than it appears needed. But not always the case. Sometimes, it's fine in that regard too.
I'v worked there and the place is DISGUSTING in the back. Go check the back out for yourself man!
I wish there was less than 1 star because now that they don't have flour chips there is no point..... It is just another Mexican restaurant :-( Super bummer.

If it were at all possible to make that a -5 stars I would.  Went here for dinner New Year's Day , they were open...surprise! By the end of the evening my stomach went sour and worsens as the night went on... Now two days later I'm still suffering through this second day of stomach virus. That which I can only trace back to this establishment. More than half my dining party all came down with some sort of virus. I've been spewing the most vile concoction of nastiness which I will not go into farther.   
This place is disgusting.  I certainly do not suggest going here.  

I hope we all recover.

OFF MY LIST PERMINENTLY

Friday special was okay.  Group of 4 we tried 3 deserts and they were not good, nothing like the picture and very tasteless.  Service could have been better.  $1.75 margaritas were good and so were the prices.

A friend and I were looking for nice place to have a bite to eat with a few drinks early one evening. We decided to stop in at Sylvia's as we'd been there once before several weeks prior and had had a pleasant time at the bar.

This visit however......ENTER THE DRAGON!!......the  bar portion of the business was closed due to its being used for a 'private party'. We found this out by asking the restaurant personnel why the bar was closed. We asked if we could order snacks and drinks while seated in the restaurant instead of sitting in the closed off bar; we were told that that would be ok and we were taken to a table, seated and were brought complimentary chips and salsa; there was only one other table in use at the time. Shortly, as our waiter/host(?) turned to leave from the table next to us where he had been taking their order, we asked for a couple of margaritas; no response from the waiter was forth coming. Several minutes later, a different waiter appeared and served the drinks ordered to the four people at that table next to us. I again tried to order from that waiter, too....his response was to quite sternly say, "I'll take your order when I get a chance."  Again, there were only two tables with a total of six patrons in the restaurant at that time.  We sat at our table for fifteen more minutes waiting for someone show us some hospitality and to let us spend some money in Sylvia's.  No one ever did come back to our table to take our order...........it was more than obvious that we were being snubbed by  Sylvia's. I have no clue at to why this was being done. We were merely sitting at our table waiting for our order to be taken.

After sitting unattended at our table for sometime, it became obvious that we weren't welcome at Sylvia's. We left and found a more friendly place to spend our money.....after all, I didn't want to have taken a shower for nothing.

Great customer service. Special thanks to Benita who was very kind and helpful when an uber driver gave out the incorrect order. She walked me through the process and even took my name and number for the owner Sylvia- who called Benita back within minutes to help resolve. I appreciate it so much, very refreshing. Thank you Benita and Sylvia.

Oiliest corn chips I've had in years, and the two salsas had no spice level to speak of, including the "hot sauce".  Huevos Rancheros was a rather small portion for the price, and the hasbrowns were simple shredded variety.  Tortillas were nice, and wife's burrito was much better.  They are full service now, and the service was just ok.  Place looks sketchy and somewhat run down during the day.  I probably would not have stopped if I hadn't heard a few good things about this restaurant.

I only go here because I don't have too many choices walking distance from work... But it's not the bomb!  It's average Mexican food.  But see I'm Mexican and cook original mexican food all the time. I promise u both my Spanish rice and my refried beans are way better than what these people serve up...

If I could give zero stars I would.  There was a time when Sylvia's was a consistent but not mentionable Mexican food.  I have no idea what happened but the ordering system is different.  We waited 10 minutes to get seated by one of what appeared to be 2 women working the whole place.  My mother and I were seated, she is 88 and asked for directions to restroom and ignored.  She found it on her own.  We waites for another 20 minutes before we got chips and salsa and our order taken by one of the two women.  Mom got a beef machaca chimichanga she enjoyed.  It was big and the beef was tasty and seasoned well.  I got the chicken flautas.  I. Can't. Even.  These were canned chicken - unseasoned - rolled in a flour (not corn as indicated) tortilla.  Cutting through these tubes if fried chicken torpedoes was an adventure in civilized eating.  I went paleo and picked them up and ate them like a rib.  The taste was non existent.  As we waited for another 20 minutes to have our bill brought I saw that there was a help wanted NOW sign in every window.  I also saw La Piñata moving in across the street and realized we were there us the death throes of a mediocre mexican restaurant.

Back when I was meeting new people, soon after moving here from Ohio, we went here on a Friday for happy hour. I wasn't impressed then; I'm not impressed now.

Sylvia's reminds me of that former lover, without whom I couldn't imagine breathing much less going on with life. But after some time apart, you realize that there is more to living. And when you have them back in your life you understand that your time apart was the best time ever. Now, you think it was a mistake to ever get involved. That's how Sylvia's plays in my life. It was there at a time when I thought it was necessary but have grown to understand we were never meant to be.

Sorry Sylvia's. I'm taking my class ring back.

Margaritas $1.50 for the entire month of May, viva Mexico ! It is Sonoran style Mexican food. The machaca is soooooo delicioso! I ordered  the old fashioned tacos, excellent choice. Have gone through the drive through and it's a disasters it's easier to go inside. The staff is not friendly and not very attentive but the machaca made it okay. Great small bar area good attmosphe. Nice date place!
